don't work no detection by the pc, soft installed, j tried with other soft it is a hardware problem

Excellent for the price. I used this Endoscope to help fish wires out of the wall for a surround sound speaker setup. I did a video write up on it here:[...]  fast forward to 8:30 for the actual video footage, if your interested.

Cons: I did notice reduction in frames per second and clarity in low light conditions, (even with built-in light). The light only works well in confined spaces where there is very nearby  objects for the light to bounce off of. Inserting the endoscope inside an acoustic guitar sound port, for example, yields poor visibility.
Did not work with Samsung Galaxy S3. Tried CameraFi and MScopes apps with no luck.
It's too flimsy to be able to direct the camera through pipes beyond 3 feet. Can't easily control it's direction of travel and orientation. Light gets hot quickly.
wow, so useless, light did not work very well, could not see down into a cylinder head on the car, which was why we bought it.

Only got about 15 minutes use out of it. It got wet, BUT was not underwater at all. In the middle of looking behind firewall in vehicle for rain water it just 'went away'.. MS Windows no longer recognized it..Tried it on different PC's running Windows10 and Vista... while it was working and when I tested it, things were great.. Image was clear and adjusting the LED lites worked fantastic.
 I am not sure if moisture got in the Camera Head or the USB Plug and Lite Control went bad. The plug end was extremely sloppy and loose. If I get another one, I will seal around cable/camera connection and beef up the USB plug. No Problem Getting Refund, So that was nice too.
Timely shipping, excellent product, and most importantly very easy to set up and use!

This product worked easily. I have Windows 8 and simply installed the software on my laptop. Camera worked well. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because  the image it provides is a little soft - resolution wise. But, other reviews mention that plus the light isn't strong enough to site down a five foot cavity to the end. Would I buy it again? Yes.
Plug & play with Photo Booth on a Mac. Great resolution!

Exactly as described.  Not the highest quality picture,  nor the brightest LEDs on the end but for the price it works fine.

I was able to peer  into the cylinders through the injector hole of my 3.0L Mercedes diesel  to see the valve stick in the piston. Now if only  this thing could pull the engine for me. ...
Works great if you don't have a integrated camera on your computer, if you do it gets all screwed up and only brings up the computer camera.
Small form factor and real easy to use, however the camera has very poor resolution.  I would recommend spending a little bit more money on a camera with higher resolution rating.
Broke less than a year. Picture is not very clear. Im not sure how its 720p. The LEDs are not bright enough to illuminate a dark space because the camera has a long focus length.

I'm using this camera on my MacBook, OS X 10.11, using Photo Booth as the viewer.  The picture quality is not great, as expected with a cheap device, but it works perfectly.  You can use it to tease your cat, or look in your own eye.  Or many other things.
The camera and lights is not centered inside the case.
Exactly what I expected. Works well and good clear photos and videos until CameraFi quit working on my Android. I hope they'll fix CameraFi soon...
Couldn't get the camera to deliver an image to the computer.  Couldn't take a picture or video. Waste of money.

Gave it 4 stars for great value for the price. Quality seems pretty good. Resolution decent if you understand the limitations of what you are doing. Software is ok at best. Can easily view on laptop screen. Picture capture still eludes me. Beats the heck out of tearing a wall open to see in. Was able to easily observe outboard cylinder condition though spark plug hole, which is why is chose this one over one with a larger camera. But again, it's not a miracle and you need to be slow and patient. I have not yet tried to attach to smartphone.
kind of hard to use, make out images as a mechanic. get a better one.

After reading reviews I wasn't sure if this would work or not but I gave it a try.  After plugging it into my USB port the LEDs came to life.  I didn't want to risk installing their software so I looked for an existing program to display the video.  I found that I could use the play capture device setting in VLC to stream the video on my windows computer with no issues.

Overall I'm very happy with the camera.  I used it to track a cable through a wall.  The small size helped (the camera is TINY) as I could easily fit it through the existing access point.  The LED brightness control worked as expected and allowed me to get a good image.  I was very happy with the focus range.  It was definitely a lot more than a few inches which seems to be an issue on some of the other similar cameras.  I used a coat hanger and later a fish tape to direct the camera where I wanted it to go.  This wasn't the easiest task but it was rather fun... like playing a video game.

I had no luck with this product.  My laptop running Windows 10 would not recognize the Compact CD.  I tried everything I could think of to get it to.  Checked the auto-run, it was on. Tried to access it through the file explorer, nothing worked.  I really wanted one to go with the laptop.  I returned it.

Didn't know I needed until I bought it! Windows 8 and above works right out of the box- no software necessary. Software & drivers for Windows 7 and earlier included.

Whether you want to see what's in that smelly duct or that mole on you back, this adjustable lighted endoscopic camera fits the bill.
Piece of junk. I couldn't get it to work with my Dell Laptop (windows), 2009 Macbook Pro, or 2015 Macbook Air.
The image went solarized after a few minutes of use. I tried it on several different phones and tablets, so it was definitely an issue with the endoscope.

After very little use, several times, the lens fell off and then the housing came off and then the connections broke very useless. it is a nice idea, the lights need a little bit of work (brighter) but it is a fantastic size
It worked once, than died.  I gave up and threw it away.
Works great could be a little bit brighter light.  Otherwise no troubles.  Good video pics.

For what it costs and for  checking out things like the condition of a gun barrel or trumpet leadpipe it's what the doctor ordered.  It will even enter a .22 barrel.. most of the time. Some .22's have a tighter muzzle for some reason. The image quality is somewhat uncertain much of the time but there are some adjustments in the program that comes with it that helps that problem.

I purchased this to allow me to inspect the inside of my chimney. It worked ok but not with the clarity I was hoping for. I think the problem was a lack of light because before and after the camera worked fine. Also the diameter of the pipe may have also been a factor. I will find other uses for this around the house so I think its worth the money.
works as advertised.  low resolution.  cant see very far from end of camera.  no control over where its pointed, but expected that.
Works well...although I hardly use it.  Just a one time purchase to help see the inside of a wall.

This is a great way to see where you can't go, investigate small openings in parts, etc.
A friend of mine used it to investigate a boat cooling heat exchanger and it works! Zip tie it to the boat hook and inspect the prop or the hull!

The 5.5mm diameter gets this into lots of places, and the longer length goes even more.
Illuminated so it works
Excellent for any inspected.
The video/picture quality is very poor. It's really grainy. There was malware embedded in the software. Don't but this product.

I love that I can buy a fiber optic camera like this for $20. It came as described, and works exactly as I expect. When a product like this can be delivered right to my house for this price, I'm amazed.

Yeah, we don't have hover boards or flying cars yet, but we definitely are living in the future!
DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ! NO SUPPORT !
Installation disc was blank.  Have been unable to use
Two drawbacks: no focus adjustment and driver is windows only. Not compatible with Mac.
The led lights up the computer see it but no picture.

The included software (AmCap) would not install on Win 7 using the setup.exe on the disk.  It would just crash the installation software.  BUT, you can just copy all the files to a new directory on your hard drive and run it from there. Apparently it does not make changes to the registry file.  Just make a shortcut to Amcap executable file and put the shortcut on your desk top.  It works... sort of.  It will not go to resolution of better than 640x480.  I don't know if that's the fault of the camera or the software.  I might try some webcam free ware.  See if it will get better resolution.  I also intend to run it on a tablet.  I am waiting for Amazon to deliver a usb to microusb converter.  I hope the resolution will be better than 640x480 on the tablet.  That is a little too primitive and not what was promised.
STOP!!  Do not purchase this product.  It is VERY POORLY documented and one cannot reach the manufacturer to discuss means for getting it to function.
Really a nice product for the price!  Does get warm/hot after a bit on the end due to the light.

view can be blurry, have to get it in just the right place. That is understandable for the small diameter size, which we expected. Served purpose. Used it to view inside car valve cylinders and to check metal roof for leaks.
great bore scope fit down 22 rifles and capture video and photos.  shorter version would be better for me butthis works well.
Not the greatest picture quality but it helped me run a new water line for my fridge so I'm happy with it

I expected more cuality, maybe is good for plumbers o people who search in a small holes something and have a portable computer with cd,s reader on it. To me is unpractical, but I have it now and maybe I will use some day for something that I don't kow yet
Works fine where there is light.  In a tight dark space of my boat, the view was pretty useless.  Might be good for a rifle bore or something close up..?
Excited when it came, installed software, worked great UNTIL i bent the flex wire and shorted out the camera. Light comes on, but camera now does not work, Overseas, no recourse......no warranty
Works perfect i could not complain at all
Worked pretty well for looking in the cylinders of my old John Deere. Needed the mirrors to do 90deg that it does not come with.
It met my expectations.  For the price, it's worth it.  The resolution is somewhat limited.
Worked great, bought 5 more for friends that I showed

Piece of garbage! It broke within three minutes of me taking it out of the box!
definitely want money back.

I doesn't do any good what seller says, video is very poor even in enough light conditions, cd driver is damaged so you need to figure it out how to use it without it and overheating is another problem you need to handle
Worked great. Image quality isn't anything to brag about. Awesome price for what it is.

Edit 8/30/15 - I tried just about everything to get this to work with a Tab 2 including different apps and rooting the tablet and changing the OS.  I finally gave up and bought a Galaxy Tab S and it DOES work with that. So I can now give it 4 stars.

Works with laptop, but disappointed it didn't work with a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2.  Tried connecting with an OTG cable and camerfi app, but can't get it to work.

Good value. Only getting 640x480 resolution from "motion" software. Have outside watching a Robin nest and it is working well.
You may want to mark the top with a piece of tape or dot of paint. I found this to be helpful for how I use it.

Performed bettert than I expected for this price.  Worked well with both Mac and  PC.  Field of view was great and the integrated LED's were super.  Worked as well at $3000 bore scopes I have used in the past.

Two of the LEDs were dead - and when it went down into the cylinders i couldn't see anything. I have a 3 minute video of nothing but darkness when it was supposed to be checking piston carbon build up.
Extremely poor viewing quality,  no focus to ID much of anything.  Not a good purchase.  I"m not happy at all. Can NOT recommend it to anyone.  Sure would be happy with a refund.

Get what you pay for. I tried to use it to inspect a clogged pipe. All mediocre reviews are correct. The picture quality is poor, not even close to what would be expected from an HD camera. Focal distance is very short and led lights are barely sufficient to illuminate subject within focal length. The view angle is also narrow, so narrow that it will not cover inside of 1 1/2" pipe with in the  focal distance of the lens. The USB connector is so flimsy it rattles and I used electrical tape to hold is together so that it would not fall apart when plugging it in or worst unplugging. I was able to use it for my need but barely and with great disappointment. I can see it performing better in other situations but fo pipe inspection it was just barely adequate if you don't expect much in first place. Would not recommend it.
Worked with an app that came with the PC. Not your high def camera but the picture is OK for viewing into inaccessible areas. Overall it works well for me.

The lens was scratched out of the box. The LEDs glare on the lens slightly washing out the picture on all brightness levels. Even on the highest brightness setting the LEDs do not put out enough light to illuminate an object from more than an inch or so away (if it's bright enough to see it's too close to get good focus and detail). On top of all that it's not 720P, it's 640x480.

Works with my Macbook (using Photo Booth) but the image is mirrored for some reason. Easy enough to mirror it back when editing but a little disorienting during use. My MB's fairly old, so I don't know if newer models have the same issue. Dimmable LEDs are a nice touch.

HD ??? L-O-L ...NOT FUNNY. its not HD.
however focus is the main issue with this - unless there's distance from the object so it's in focus ... if there's something in front it will be blurry like fk, you have no ideak wtf you're looking at.

This would be 3 stars. But the price is just so great! I was in need of a scope to check a cylinder on an engine. Most of these run upwards of $200. However, I thought for the price, I would give it a try.

The video clarity isn't the best. I am sure there are similar products that have a higher quality.

However, at this price point? It really is hard to beat. If you are looking to read fine print inside of a dark hole, this may not be the best.

But to get an eye on the inside, and to do it quickly and at a low price point? It can't be beat.

Since using it on the engine, I have used it around the house several times. By hooking it up to my laptop, I am able to get a very good look in small openings. Gun barrels, drain pipes, even inside the wall running wires!
Be very careful with it, easy to break the USB end.
640x480 resolution, but for the price, it's amazing. Built in illumination, 15 feet long, can be hooked up to a Samsung Galaxy S4 for use on the go, Sam Fisher would be envious!
Good for the purpose I use to see down gun barrels for cleaning inspections..is not as good lens quality as others but good enough
Works well, just the usb plug is loose
Better then expects.  This camera has great resolution, especially close-ups.
Poor resolution and no focus.  Not usable as otoscope.

The quality of the image from the camera and "craftsmanship" of the product is not 5-Star, but for the price, I considered rating it a five instead of a four. I used this to check for an obstruction in one of my PVC vent pipes. Found the birds nest and got it taken care of, money well spent. I connected the camera to my fish tape and it was rugged enough to be fed into the pipe. I also used it to check one of my sinks. The LED lights at the end are not super bright, but bright enough to illuminate a 1" to 4" (or so) pipe. There is a little luminance adjustment on the USB end of the light to control the brightness. I can confirm that this works with Windows 7 and Fedora 21 (64-bit).

One LED was not working so I returned the item...thanks again to Amazon for the simple return!  Also, the image was not as clear as my first phone camera ten years ago, I was very disappointed in the resolution of the image and do not recommend this product.
Work for two days then the lights stop working. Not happy
I downloaded a driver that allowed me to use my Andriod phone as a screen. Helped find a leak in my hot tube. ALso used this to insoect and repair a tub drian in my home.
software is not compatible with windows XP and 7 no instructions on finding drivers or how to install software.

Not quite what I was hoping for.  I was not expecting great image quality from a $20 borscope.  But the real issue with this item is the focus distance.  The minimum focal distance for this unit is about 3cm.  Anything closer that that is blurry.  This works ok for some applications, but in tight spots it is no good.  This also is a problem with the lights on this camera.  They are not bright enough to light up dark areas more than about 5 or 6 cm away, but when you get close enough for the lights, to work, you are too close for the camera to focus.  The software that comes with the camera works fine, but I was not able to get it to work with some other applications that I have used in the past.

To Me,  It's Amazing. The Picture Quality Is Grate, The Lights Work. Don't Know How Waterproof It Is Yet. The Cable, Is More Than I Need. I Got It For Work, Unable To Use It Yet. Can't  Get The Software To Load On My Amazon Fire.
I am a professional technician and this "borescope " worked very well for me. I use it with my phone.
It works. Hope it was a little more stiff.

junk,,did not even work,,,1 1/2 led out,usb end started to come apart
Would not advise to buy
Great endoscope for the price.  It has a usb interface.  You can use the camera to view, record or capture images.  The light intensity is adjustable on the usb connector.
Did not work for me cause my computer not working and can not use it on anything less it has USB, I Gabe it away.

I purchased the USB Endoscope because my wedding ring fell behind the backsplash on my kitchen counter. I tried looking with a mirror, a camera and flashlight, couldn't see anything. The small endoscope camera with LEDs was perfect. Once I figured out which program to use on the computer, I put it behind the counter and it didn't take 30 seconds to see my ring. The image is reversed so it took some concentration to snag my ring with a hooked piece of wire, but once I did it came out fairly easy, Well worth $20, as opposed to a hasty kitchen remodeling project. If you do engine work or musical instrument repair this would be good for that too. I looked inside a guitar I recently bought, the camera has a good picture and the adjustable LEDs are bright.

As stated in previous You get what pay for a 20 dollar camera.  Great for minor look in the hole jobs. I love it for what I need it for which is to check the bore on my rifles. Now, if your looking for small detail in firearms this not for you. However, if you just want to  check for debris and  pitting or light rust in barrel this is good enough to check all bores down to .22lr and 5.56.  Yes It just fits with a little wiggling but be careful  also play with settings in the software for a better picture

Main purpose is to look down shower/sink drains. I hooked it up to my android smartphone via micro USB to USB adapter. image quality is like most others say, good to acceptable. Not great, but for the inexpensive price, that's exactly what I was expecting. The LED is also poor to acceptable in illuminating the shower drain. My next use for this is to drill a hole in the wall to check if the shower is really leaking or if its just my imagination. Although due to its lack of holding shape, I'm going to have to plan this out first.
I like it , it does what I need and more  TKS OZZY
Brought a micro usb adapter and use it with my phone.  Very handy tool to have around.  Good picture quality too.

Video quality is very very low res, looks like an old vhs...probably not even that good. I have ear tubes...I had one blow out. While I don't expect to self diagnose myself, I just wanted to be able to see if they are in place ...the last time I went in to the doc, he showed me my eardrum and it was plain to see there was a big prob so I got this camera. With this camera, you just cant see much detail  when looking inside something. It's just very low quality video in general.
At the same time, what can you expect for a $20 endoscope . I rolled the dice and it's not so hot. My bad...I won't return it, it's $20 worth of endoscope. I'd suggest probably look at ones that cost a bit more and maybe have some youtube video's showing the video quality.
This one is just not worth even the $20 , because you just cant see anything clearly so it's kind of useless. Yes, I cleaned the lens. I have many camera's, GoPro's and many other electronics all my life ...i'm the guy everyone calls to help or fix their stuff. Trust me, save your money.

Worked perfect for my needs. I was able to get it into an attic that has no access to allow viewing.
I will be using this on our boat.
Simple software and great equipment though lacking in strength I just used sturdy hanger wire to snake it through. Not back at all
After testing this unit I am very pleased with this device. Works as designed . Great picture quality. I use it for inspections.
Camera is low megapixels. LED is not as bright as I hoped with 6 led's.

I buy several different models of inspection cameras and resell them at snowmobile shows and swaps.  They sell themselves.  I sell them to repair shops and to people who work on their own motors.  They can look inside the engine for damage without disassembling it first.  I have used one to locate a problem inside the third door on my son's 2003 Chevy S-10.  It wouldn't open.  I located the problem and fixed it.  What a wonderful tool!  All you need is a laptop computer.

For the money this is a phenomenal product. It took me a little while too make it work with my s4 smart phone, but once I found the app it was easy and versatile. Usb camera is what the app is called. Great buy would recommend highly.

2 of the 6 LED's are very dim. But it still works well. The real test will be how long it last.

Scott
Works pretty good, software that came with did not work, got other software and everything works good. The picture is a little blurry sometimes but these usually are.
It's nice, small and compact. Has a preset focal length. If you want to view something up close, SOL. Software supplied is generic common found on other scopes.

Very impressed with this camera. bought it to inspect some ductwork under my house. The camera worked great and focused to infinity as promised. Just used an adapter to plug it into my android tablet and with a webcam app it worked perfect. Never could get the PC to read the little CD, but didn't need it. This thing must have 20 ft of cable.
CON: The adjustable lights worked as advertised, but are so small they are not much good trying to see more than about 4-6 inches. Since I needed to see further in the dark, I taped a bright key chain type light onto the camera. That worked pretty well, but then it was hard to orient the camera so I knew which way was up. Ended up taping the whole thing on the end of a flat stick I could push along, knowing how it was oriented. I think it is a great buy.

It worked for a while under Windows 8. No need to use the CD that came with it as it self installs & the Win 8 camera app does the basics for you. The picture was pretty grainy & washed out, but probably acceptable for most applications. After dipping it in my pool water to inspect a pipe, it died within 60 seconds. Assuming that it is a typical chinese quality control issue, I'm going to return & order another one. Hopefully I will get lucky & the next one will actually be waterproof as the description claims.
In a bright lite room it gives a good picture but in a wall cavity the 6 LED's are useless and you can see nothing. A total waste of money

For about $20, this was very worth it.

Mine came without a software disc, but I didn't plan on using that anyways. Still the description says it comes with one so that brings the product down to 4 stars. "UsbWebCamera" on the Google Play store worked just fine for my purpose.

Along with this I purchased a $4 USB OTG adapter. So, I managed to connect this to a galaxy S5. Essentially, I now have a 720p camera with a 0.217" (5.5mm) diameter at the end of a 16' cable connected to a pocket size HD display for <$25.

My wife uses it to check for ear infections/inflammation, so the small diameter really helps. We also have one that has a 0.276" (7mm) camera. That will become my work one now, because it is just a little too big to shove in an ear...

The LED's are pretty bright and don't make the end too hot. The adjust-ability is also better than our other scope, even though it has a noticeable jump from medium to high intensity.

The focus does seem to be infinite, but it seems at any distance things are a little fuzzy. Still for what it is, I'm happy.
Only issue with this is that it is not Android friendly.

The camera is very small (5 mm) and has a narrow field of view.  This is adequate for its function - looking into small spaces that are difficult to get to.  I am planning on using it to view my HVAC duct work using a fish tape to get the camera into the duct work.  The included cable is too flexible to force the camera anywhere (a good thing as it increases where it can go).  The image is in color and detail is good.  You will need video software to use it (my laptop could not read the included CD and I could not find a manufacturer site to download it).  I was able to use Movie Maker (Win7) to view the camera.  I have the 15m version and purchased a 15m USB extension to attach to the cable should I need it.

I do have a concern for the lens on the camera - it is exposed.

This seems to be a bargain for the price. I expect you could find a scope with better overall performance but the price would reflect it. So far so good, still trying to figure out how to save images.

It would get 4 stars but the disk did not work with windows 8
I did use it on my galaxy s5 active with a adapter and a free app that was pretty awesome

I needed to use the included software- computer did not automatically turn on pre-loaded webcam software. Installed the camera no problem. Magnet, wire thing included are helpful for pushing it along. I would like a bit more stiffness in the cable to be able to push into ducts / farther away, without curling up on itself.
Connected to my laptop running Windows 8.1, and used the camera app that came loaded on the computer. Picture quality is as good as to be expected from such a small camera.  It got the job done.
You can never be 100% sure where viruses come from, but I am almost positive this camera installed a Trojan horse when I used it

this thing is total crap. no where near 720p and the lights make everything you view either washed out or gray with no contrast. The dial to adjust the LED is not linear, there is a large amount of adjustment that occurs on the first 1/5th of the dial. The rest of the dial is basically useless.

I am returning this because it is useless for my purpose. buyer beware
focus and clarity is not what i expected. maybe at this price, you shouldn't expect more but i would not recommend.
Junk in my opinion. The image was terrible.

The borescope works as intended and I do like it.  The only drawback to my order was that a set of 3 borescope mirrors showed up as being compatible with this scope but they were not (would not fit and not for this particular scope).  The mirrors that showed up are Yunanwa Supereyes Borescope Side View Mirror Set 30 45 60 degrees for Borescope Endoscope N005 N013J N015 series.  So if you order this scope, and see these mirrors listed as being a good add-on to your order, do not get them as they do not fit this unit.
You have to spend money to get a good camera. Don't waste your money... You're not going to be seeing Jack.
Works great until you smash it between a piston and cylinder head
This was a gift. My son liked it - no details.
It works on my Mac with no problem
I curl my eyelashes on a regular basis and wanted something to help the corners where my eyelash curler doesn't reach. This item doesn't curl at all. I gave it time and tried many times.
I enjoy using the mini heated eyelash curler after I've applied my mascara. It helps to hold the curl too.

I hardly ever wear mascara because I have short, heavy, sparse, and very straight lashes. Mascara looks good for ten seconds and then the lashes just droop.  Gave this little mini heated curler a try and, by gosh, it actually looks like I have eyelashes now--a bit of an upward turn which lasts for at least part of the evening.  I'm not talking long lush curly lashes here but certainly better than before. I think if you have good lashes to start, you would look great with this curler.  I curl the lashes before applying mascara, put a light layer of mascara on and curl once again. Worth the money for me.

I have tried everything for curling my eyelashes, and nothing seemed to work. I had never even heard of a heated eyelash curler, but once I found out there was such a thing, I ordered one! And I love it! It curls my eyelashes in no time, and you don't have to worry about the heat burning your eye, you can't even feel it. I love it and wish I had heard about this a LONG time ago!!

I'm sorry but it did not work at all for me.  In all fairness, maybe it is because I have very straight eyelashes,I'm not sure.  I read all the reviews and some were good and some were bad so I went ahead and bought this but wish I hadn't now.  For me, it was a waste of money.

This is a really nice little curler.  The heat is soft and warm.  No clamping necessary - just a few up-strokes!  This curl is a soft one, so if you're looking for a 'tight' curl, you may want to use regular curler.  AND... it EATS batteries... so be prepared :)
It doesn't work as stated in the  description
This did nothing for me.  I have pretty long eyelashes so I don't know,  maybe this is only supposed to be used with short lashes?

I'm not a big fan of this heated eyelash curler.. the very very small amount of curling it does doesn't last and I've tried both with Mascara and without multiple times.. Cute idea but definitely a waste of money. Using my hair dryer to heat up my regular eyelash curler works much better
Loved this eyelash curler until the case cracked, no longer connecting the source of heat from the battery to the device. Such a bummer.
It is the perfect temp.  It doesn't burn but seems to sooth.  I am still perfecting my use of it.

didnt' work at all
battery got stuck in side

I like it. My boyfriend told me that he doesn't want me to wear fake lashes anymore. So. I purchased this. And every time that I use this he asks me if I'm wearing fake lashes. I just wink at him and say no it's my real lashes.

Save your money. This didn't curl my eyelashes very well. I use curl my eyelashes and put on WATERPROOF mascara before-hand and I can BARELY tell a difference. Product feels very cheaply made as well. You would think with a price like this that you would get a well-made product that works well.

It's my first time using a heated eyelash curler and I like it more than the manual clamp.  It works better once your mascara is on.  I've only used it a few times so I'm just getting used to it.  Nice and compact too.  I've only tried it on my top lashes.  I cleaned it with a tissue afterwards so I hope it doesn't get too gloppy.
This is fantastic for those of us who have brittle or hard to curl lashes. It's link a mini curling brush for your lashes.  It works better than any traditional curler I've ever used!

I used to have great natural lashes with just the right natural curve.  2 years ago, after a rapid and drastic weight loss, my lashes went completely straight - absolutely no curl AT ALL. I stopped using mascara altogether, when previously that was the number one product I used - the one thing I wanted, even when I was in a rush and didn't have time for anything else.

This curler, when used together with a traditional clamp curler, is an absolute make-up godsend.  Clamp curlers have a tendency to make 90 degree angles in lashes, which is even more unattractive than no curl at all!  This curler takes the 'fold' out, and smoothly sweeps the lashes around and up until they look completely natural.  Took a little practice, but now I can get my lashes looking great in under 5 minutes.

Works like a charm - EXCELLENT value for the money - love it love it love it!

I have long, full and straight eyelashes so I thought this "highly" recommended heated curler would do the trick since regular curlers don't seem to do the trick for me.  I returned this after 2 weeks because (1) it no longer heated, and (2) when it did heat, it did not curl my lashes.  I don't understand why it was on the recommended list.  Total waste of money!

wish I would have tried it earlier!  I love this!  Use it after applying a LIGHT coat of mascara, hold in place for a few seconds....or use a sweeping motion.  NO eyelashes are crimped, or falling out.  a life saver for someone that wakes up with her eyelashes going all directions~ I don't have to depend on my eyelash curler that damages my eyelashes anymore!

I have had about four of these curlers.  The design is great, and the curler was recommended by a well-known makeup artist.  I find they stop working in about 4 to  6 months.  I contacted the company several times about this problem, but I never got an answer.  One great feature is that when  you put  the top back on, it turns the switch off.

It's not magic and it definitely takes patience but it does make a bit of a difference. It says to use the product after applying mascara but because I would rather not risk getting it caked with mascara, I choose to use it before I apply. It takes some several strokes to see a difference. It also doesn't get very hot, so it can rest on your eyelid and not bother you. That said, I wouldn't be concerned about the heating feature. I get the best results when I comb my lashes out first, use this heated eyelash curler second, then follow it with a clamp eyelash curler. Directly after this process, I apply my primer and then my mascara and my lashes look big and flawless. The process is not fast! It does take about 5 - 7 minutes. I would recommend turning on the curler (pushing the switch up so that the little red dot comes on) at the beginning of your makeup routine so that when you get to your lashes it's already warmed up and ready to go. FYI it does not come with a battery.
Does not curl my lashes at all, I was disappointed in this purchase
Stopped working after less than 10 uses. Worked well when it actually did work, though.

The battery doesnt seem to connect too well in the product.
It's always a hit or miss when trying to curl my eyelashes with this in the mornings.
Works great. Get's the clumps off with ease.

Battery needs to be replaced every week, at least. I never dropped it and the battery compartment is cracked so sometimes it is not connected and it's not warming up when I think it is. With a fresh battery, I do love the results but the product itself could use some tweaking.

Honestly, I have no idea what this is supposed to do for my face in the long run. I take care of the problem areas of my skin with other products so even if it did some small thing, I'd never know. What I do know is the superfine mist feels awesome when my skin is overheated or tired during the day which will be a lot during the summer. The mist is cool and slightly moisturizing without any daily long-term effects like greasiness or astringency. I've been using it a couple of weeks and had no breakouts which means it passed a major product test for me. In winter I would probably call this more of a luxury than a necessary beauty product but as we go into summer and the hot, damaged skin season, it seems more like something good to have on hand as a treat.

I don't see any benefits provided by this spray. The stars I'm giving are for the great design of the bottle. I wish I had a bottle like this for all my sprays, it's right between being a mist and a spray so it layers on your skin nicely. But I've used this on myself repeatedly now and see no benefits or any kind of difference on my skin. I don't recommend it, seems like a gimmicky waste of money.

I don't really get it. I've been using this product for a few weeks, and I've not noticed any benefit. My skin doesn't feel or look different. I can see where a mist would feel refreshing after working out, or during the summer. I think it's important to moisturize right after washing my face with clean water, to help retain the moisture. It's also my understanding that, under most circumstances, minerals and other nutrients work from the inside out, not sprayed on top just to evaporate.

I'm not sure what I was expecting with this spray. As mentioned, this will probably be refreshing on a hot day. But I'm just not seeing any other benefit.

I have a condition called keratosis pilaris on my legs and my face. I have tried many products to help with this. Some work and some do not. I have been using this for about a week and I am pretty pleased with the results. First of all, parts of my face are extremely dry, while other parts are somewhat oily. I find that this spray works well for my combination skin. It feels moisturized, but not greasy. I wash my face with a charcoal soap, then spray this on and allow it to dry naturally and apply my makeup as usual. I also use it when I need a refresher midday and before bed. I love it!

This is a lot like the previous Vichy product I tried (Vichy Pureté Thermale 3-in-1 One Step Micellar Cleansing Water) but the application process is quite different. This is a product you just spray on your face, I kept my eyes closed when I did this and tried to keep it out of my hair. I left the spray on for a couple of minutes; the directions are vague in this regard. The product felt a bit sticky as the previous product from Vichy did but in this case the directions said to dry my face off after that vague amount of time and that helped with the stickiness.

The application was a bit off-putting for me. I didn't feel like it gave me enough control over how much went on my skin and where it went. Even after using it for two weeks I never felt completely comfortable with it. It did not irritate my very sensitive skin and the stickiness was removed with wiping it off.  But the application oddness and the fact that this product didn't do anything to improve my skin means I won't buy it.

My wife won't put any chemicals or weird things on her skin. She sticks primarily to pure oil products that don't contain things such as alcohol or preservatives. She has tried Vichy a number of times after bathing and found it pleasant, but she feels inconclusive on its benefits. It is always difficult to determine whether certain products are really having a positive effect. This would include things such as skin care products, vitamins and food supplements. It can only be judged on a subjective level which is prone to all kinds of variables. Unless something has immediately caused a bad reaction or problem; tough to tell.
It seems that there is nothing bad in the Vichy, which is why she agreed to try it. So far she says its nice.

Testing this as a free product from the Amazon Vine program.

This is a very nice and easy to use product that has become part of the daily routine.
Fine mist spray that moisturizes withour ever feeling greasy, or like you're wearing a mudpack.
So easy to spray and go, let it sit for a minute and gently dry.
Time will tell on the results, but my skin feels great.
The research backing up this product seems credible after an internet search.

My wife has used this for three days.  After washing her face she sprayed it on then dabbed it off after it had been on for a few minutes.  Then she said her skin felt soft, and smooth.  The softness she noted lasted all day ....much longer than when she used lotion.  Unless product is extremely expensive, it looks like they've got a steady customer.

One note: My wife does not use makeup.  We do not know if her highly positive reaction would be less or, perhaps, even more dramatic weee she one who did.

I am familiar with Vichy products and have always had a positive experience with products from this brand.  I wasn't sure what to expect from a can of expensive water.  The bar was low for this.

Unfortunately, I had a skin reaction to a food allergy and my skin was dry, irritated, and a bumpy, broken out mess.  Having previously dealt with this condition, I know that it takes about 2 weeks to completely heal.  The Vichy Mineralizing Thermal Spray Water arrived on day 2 of my reaction.  Ive used it daily for the past 5-days and the bumps/irritation has almost completely disappeared.  The skin that Ive used it on is no longer itchy or dry.  I have no new bumps or dermatitis.

Im sold on this product.

I love this item my issue is how it was packaged and arrived. The ttem arrived unsealed with a cracked top with a large hole in it. The rest of the top is not in the box so it appears it was packaged broken. Also it feels lighter than 10 oz, bottle sounds half full when shaken like it may have been previously used. I've ordered a bottle of this previously with no issues it was sealed and the top was unbroken and securely on.

The product receive is fake, not authentic. I been using the Vichy thermal water in the past and has a different consistency, the one receive it just plain water no mineral .Fake product, so disippont
This is a nice mineral water spray.  Its unique in that it contains salts in amounts you can taste.  Some may not like that, but I find it soothing for eczema prone skin.

I purchased this product in September and by mid-November, it was clogged to the point that it would not spray anymore.  I am very disappointed in the efficiency and usefulness of this container. I probably used less than a 1/4th of the bottle.
I feel so refreshed after using this spray. After using every morning for over a week I could see a difference in my skin, much softer and smooth.

I guess that I do not have the sophistication to appreciate a $18 can of mineral water that has 10.1 ounces in it. I used this product as directed and nothing..It is refreshing to spray on your face when it is clean, but I think that I can get the same effect by taking a spray bottle and using some good ol American mineral water.  I am not sure why the French mineral water is so much better than mineral water made any place else, but for 25 cents for a 20 ounce bottle compared to $18 I think that I will buy American mineral water. I am also a believer that your skin must be hydrated from the inside out. You can spray the entire can on your whole body, but if you have not put fluids inside your body, it is not going to do any good.  My entire family gets together on the 4th of July for a pool party and I plan to use the VICHY spray to keep me cool while Im sitting outside in the heat by the pool and plan to drink lots and lots of water to keep me hydrated.

In comparison with other anti cellulite massagers this one does its job. The suction is very good, and i see improvement (I use maximum speed and maximum suction, cause light level would not work for me). As for device itself I give 5 stars, but I'm not agree with instructions how to use cream. The massager doesn't work without cream indeed, as the surface of the skin should be slippery,but the machine suck it out of  from the surface of  the skin,  and I have to put cream again and again, what a waste of product and money! I decided to put baby oil, work with the machine, and after I put cream.  This way  i get even better results, the machine slips better. But this is just my own experience. And of course I agree, without diet and proper exercises none massager is going to really help. By the way, regarding excersises,  I may suggest really good DVD to fight cellulite, that I use myself along with the massage, it is  "Lower Body Workout" from Ballet Body by Leah Sarago you can find it here on Amazon. it is challenging and very effective.

I've been using this tool for three weeks now, and I can totally see the difference in the appearance of cellulite and fat. My skin feels so much tighter and smoother now.
Of course it doesn't make any miracles, however if you combine it with regular exercise and diet, the results can be great!
I love the suction and the pulsation that it makes leaving your skin red which you can see it working deeply. Just be careful with the suction power because it can pick in your skin and it hurts. Also, always apply fat girl slim before you use it :))
So in love with this machine! I've always dreamed of something like that I can use at home because doing treatments at spa such as endermology or vela shape can cost a lot of money.
Highly recommended!

I'm loving it!!
The suction power is definitely strong enough, and you can feel it even at the lowest level! The size of the machine is very good to use and too keep at home.
At the first day it wasn't so easy to use, but now I got used to. I can't say yet if it's effectiv because it's my first week using it, but I can say the feeling is so good.
This small thing feels like a professional machine!!! Very powerful

Ok so I raved in my last review about how great this product was. It was actually that great (a bit painful but great nonetheless) and worked until it stopped suctioning 2 weeks in. What a disappointment!  I teetered on the verge of just trading it in for another one since it works so well but due to the fact that most people who have a problem with it complained about it stopping suction I figured it would only be a matter of time before the next one stopped working so I sadly it turned it back in. If it could have at least lasted 6 months it would be worth it but 2 weeks is surely not enough for the money spent on this product.
Returned it. Didn't see visible results after suggested use.
This machine can succionar your skin and you can feel how works desapearing the cellulite.  I ove it,
This is not worth the money.  It barely sucks and doesn't seem to do anything.

Honestly, this item has so much potential. But, the company bliss has done a terrible job bringing this concept into fruition.

The lipomassage unit worked awesome for three weeks, but has lost all suction power. I can't even use it now. I did everything as instructed. I may look into replacing the battery (maybe it's a cheap battery?).

Please, don't waste your money.

This machine worked well, once. I used it twice: the night I got it and the morning after. I loved how it worked - I tried it again two weeks later, I can not get the machine to turn off , the button to turn it off doesnt do anything, it stopped finally when the battery died. There is also no suction whatsoever - the vacuum part stopped working after just two times - don't waste your money - The product in theory is a good concept - If only the machine worked more than a total of 10 minutes before losing all suction

This is a big waste of money ,the suction is very weak ,the machine is very heavy and very hard to use ,my cheap cellulees MD does better job and much stronger suction than this piece of junk,I bought it because I thought it would be made of better materials than the cheap celluless MD blastic since it costs 145 $, i wish there was no star option,SHAME ON YOU BLISS.

Bought at my local make-up & skincare store. Crappy product Suction was intermittent (sometimes worked, sometimes didn't). When it did work, even at the lowest setting, the machine would latch onto my skin and refused to budge, even if I pressed the suction release button. But most of the time, no suction at all. I tried the cream that came with it, and my own lotions. Checked the filter to make sure it was clean. No dice. Add to all of this that it's louder than my vacuum cleaner. All in all, hated it, and returned it a few days later.
Don't buy! The concept works but the device does not.
It was wonderful for about 2 weeks then it stopped all suction and thus useless. WAY too expensive of a product for the amount of time it will last. Disappointing to say the least.
Terrible. Gave black and blue marks all over my legs did not work at all. I wasted my money and would never recommend to anyone!

I have been using it for 3 weeks, at least once a day, sometimes twice a day, and using it with both the fatgirlslim cream, and, what actually works better with it is the fatgirlslim six-pack abs gel. I also use the scrub with the slimulator every day too. I haven't changed my diet or exercise, and I am not overweight, I have a BMI of 22, but have some cellulite on my outer thighs. Using this (well, using all the products combined with this) really made the skin in my outer thigh absolutely feel tighter and firmer, and mildly reduced the look of cellulite. Not a huge difference, but there definitely has been a difference. I am going to keep using it and hopefully have more results.

I've been getting professional ENDERMOLOGIE at $50 a pop for years now with some good results but was considering buying a home unit WELLBOX for $1500 when my friend told me about this wonderful little machine. Needless to say I was pretty excited about the $145 price and decided to give it a try.
I've only had this thing for 3 days now and used it more then once a day each day with Nivea gel and let me tell ya -- it feels just like the professional machine at my salon. The suction is just as hard and the results are just the same, as in noticeable right away!! Of course these are subtle results but I can definitely see a difference in my thighs after just 6 or 7 uses!!

Quit working after light use.  Contacted Bliss and was told to contact seller who's policy is a 30 day return, which is no longer valid in my case.  I told Bliss their product states a one year warranty and I did register online and now I understand what others are saying about the machine losing all suction function which makes it useless.  I believe there is a mechanical defect according to other reviews and I hope Bliss stands by their product and issues a refund or exchange.  I've called them twice and was told "someone will get back to you shortly".  I had high hopes with this little machine for treating minor skin uneveness on my upper abdomen, my weight is 118 lbs. and I only used it on a small area for just a few weeks worth, each session about 10 minutes.  I bought it through Amazon and was shipped to me by Skindirect, I also sent them an e-mail asking for advice.  We will see if they do call and issue me a refund because the customer service rep said she'll have to talk to her manager because I did not buy the machine from them directly.

I am very frustrated.
I can't speak to efficacy, because the machine broke and I can't get any feedback or help from Bliss.
I used the machine for 2 weeks, and then it stopped working. I'm a petite person, I used it only a couple minutes every day. But it broke. Even at the highest setting, the suction barely pulls now.

I emailed their customer service, didn't hear back, so I called, and a rep said I would receive a phone call and email within 24 hours. It's been 4 days and I've heard nothing.
I would love the opportunity to try this out for a couple months but Bliss has been very unhelpful and unresponsive.
This works.  But honestly I must be a bit of a wimp as I find it a little painful as it sucks up the skin and rolls (bit like pinching).  So have only used it a couple of time.

I do not like this machine. It's more like a Fischer price toy.

Wife likes it! It works but takes some time. Be ready for some black and blues...
Definitively great!. I have two week using it and the changes are inmediatly. The cream very little. But i use other anticelulite cream.

While nothing but weight loss will help the appearance of cellulite long term, this does help circulation so I bought it for my diabetic mother to use on her legs and after regularly soaking in lavender chamomile, and using the massaging lean machine, her feet and calves look completely normal again.
this was difficult to use and not worth the time. I felt it was either killing me and sucking too hard, or it wasn't sucking at all, and I was getting nothing out of it.

I don't recommend this product it's not worth the money. The lotion is very bad  ... and cleaning the machine too.
My advice save the money and get a better  machine. ;)
A little more difficult to use than I thought it would be, but is okay for an at home treatment
not worth the money it has poor suction.
Fair amount of suction. I had to pry a cheek out of it a time or two. You will see results if you keep at it. Diet and exercise also helps.

Could not get this to effectively work for me. A few friends with different body types tried too, but with the same results. I've heard great things about this little machine from massage therapists. just couldn't get it to satisfactorily work for me.

Meh. A lot of work and pain for me. Lost interest after the first few times. Did not see any results.

It works but you have to use it weekly and exercise and eat fresh and clean foods.
It really helps, but you should use it every day! I love this machine!!!!

I get endomologie treatments after my plastic surgery and I use this in between treatments daily. It works just like the machine which for anyone who doesn't know what endomologie is, it disperses the cellulite so you don't get lumpy after lipo. The suction on here and the pulsation obviously isn't quite as strong as a professional machine that cost $50,000 but it definitely works and helps just as well! I didn't have an issue using it on my butt either. Just turn on your side and bend your knees. These reviews that say it's hard to hold or hard to maneuver around their butt are either not flexible AT ALL or they aren't very clever. Can't reach the back? Then stand up!

Love this product.  Used to get endomology treatments- but this is a much cheaper and effective alternative.  Only reason for 4 stars is that I am not a fan of the cream.  I would recommend using a cocoa butter instead- which helps the machine glide better.
I have definitely noticed a difference in cellulite on my legs and use the product daily.

It is hard to hold it because it is heavy for one hand only and I have been using it every other day for a couple of weeks now but still didn't see any changes. It is only good to use in the legs. Not so good for stomach and not made to use in arms and butty;)

It's been 2 weeks and I do notice a nice difference.  I use the machine everyday.  I use the lotion every day, sometimes twice a day.  The lotion clumps up and is sticky with clothes on so I only use a little bit.  I ended up using aloe vera gel with the machine and if I have time in the morning I will use it with the lotion and then shower.  I also have been scrubbing every morning with coffee grounds and use a handle held percussion massager everyday. I will update in a few weeks!
I really have noticed a difference on my thighs. I think this product seems to do what the description says it will do....so far so good.

Looses suction after a few sessions and really need a friend or partner to help.
I like the feeling but no results.
My husband used it every night on me for 6 weeks and I was just left disappointed

I use this 3x's a week and have seen some slight improvement. I started with the settings at the lowest and worked my way up. Eventually I got to the last setting and am hoping I can still see some more benefits but I may have reached the max, still trying though. Coconut oil works good if you don't want to keep using the fatgirl cream.
Great product, I use it an I see good results an I will continue to use this an get other stuff for it.

This little machine works well. At first it hurt a bit until you get use to it.  The cream is a piece if crap it dries fast. I use baby oil and it slides better.  The shipping was very very fast.  I'm very happy  with the purchase
I think the bottom line is that nothing is going to take away cellulite.  Exercise, diet, strength training are the best you can do.  I saw no results with this.
It takes a while to get use to using it but I can tell it is working slowly though. The cream doesn't work that well, it dries up quickly and so I use palmers oil instead.

You can feel hardness to use the lean machine yourself alone,.

I'm not convinced this did anything for me but add some vericose veins.  The lotion products needed to operate the device are "stupid expensive."

it is hard to use my hand get tierd tring to left that thing on my leg i did not see much diffrence i stop using it while ago what waste of money .i think using the plastic bruch around my leg is better
The product burns and is not very good.  I should have done a better job on research before I purchased this item.

I've been using this machine almost daily for about three weeks and definitely notice an improved appearance in the surface of my skin.  Less dimpling, smoother, husband says it feels smoother to his touch also.

I train hard 6-7 days a week, have a really clean diet and am very lean, but at 40+ the dimpling is there even though there isn't much fat.  I doubt this machine will help you if fat loss or a change in your body's actually shape is your goal.  I think its well suited to someone who just wants to change how the contour of the skin's surface looks.

I only used it twice and it worked for me, the cellulite on my arms is barely noticeable.  For me it works and I will continue to use it. I did search online for reviews and one person said she uses Nivea Cellulite gel cream instead of the fatgirlslim and thats what I did, the Niva is absorbed into the skin and it's not messy so nothing to clean up.  I did go slow over my skin and the areas turned red from the machine which they said the machine was doing its job.  I think it was a good buy for me.
Not much suction .... Hard to use on buttocks area .... Not happy, can I return or is this non refundable?

I bought this machine because it replicates the Velashape concept. I had success with the Velashape and thought that it would be more convenient and cheaper to do it myself. Wrong. It is very awkward to hold, especially when doing the back of your thighs. And the cream you are instructed to rub on your thighs prior to using the machine wears off fast. You have to keep reapplying so that the machine can glide on your skin, and the bottle of cream is so small it fits in the palm of your hand. Unfortunately, I would rather pay the extra money for Velashape!
This device really works well despite some criticism.  The trick is to use adequate amounts of cream and oh boy the suction rivals any spa machine.

I bought this product about a month ago in hopes it would help with the puckering on my buttocks and thighs.  I started using a firming lotion in addition to the cream supplied and keep it on the highest level (can hurt a bit) and noticed a big difference already.  I would recommend it, just be patient and keep up with it and drinking a good amount of water,  exercising and eating sensible.

I've been using the Lean Machine for 5 days now and have noticed a decrease in the appearance of my cellulite - my husband has also noticed!  I am 5'2", 130 lbs.  I am fit, and exercise a minimum of 5 days per week, but I am plagued with a large booty and cellulite on the back of my legs, hips, butt, and quads.  I've noticed the most change in my hip area thus far, but do see changes on all parts of my legs.

The product does take some getting used to.  I normally lay on my back and extend my leg into the air to get the back of the leg, especially where it connects to my rear.  I use just a bit of the Fat Girl Slim, and then use another layer of oil (almond/jojoba blend) to make is glide smoothly.

Overall, I say this product is a hit.  It does reduce the appearance of cellulite, and it is a great leg massager after a hard run.  Worth the money.
Wish I never spent the money.  Doesn't work with any ease at all.  I find myself just masssaging in the FatGirlSlim lotion vigorously to stimulte my legs.

I really like it. it feels like it works when it used because it massages and and has suction at the same time, I like that it has different settings. my legs look smoother, the only problem I have is that its a little hard to get the back of my thighs with it.  all in all its worth it though.
i used my friends machine (she bought it at sephora) you really se that machine works on you and gives you a really nice results, but that one that sent to me is definitely broken!

The machine is cumbersome to use and the suction is barely felt on the majority of areas.  The cream dried and balled up as I massaged over it immediately.  Also it hurt my wrist and hand as I used it on my thighs.

I recommend it but when I bought it it wasn't clear that the Fat Girl Slim cream was included.
Luckly it was! Maybe it should be more clear about the products specifications

I tried this machine for several weeks and I think it is a waste of money. Not only is it time consuming, painful as it suctions your skin in some cases very hard but really did not produce any results. I am of average weight and relatively fit and I thought this would help but all I can say is...dont waste your money!
trying to be consistent with my use of this product.  I do think I'm seeing results.  Thank you very much.
I like this machine. It is everything it's cracked up to be. Try it out today. It's worth the bucks!

Great purchase! Very easy to handle it's lightweight  and amazing suction. It does help a lot with cellulite you just got to use it at least 3 times a week. Personally I use almond oil, the machine roles better than with lotion. The other days of the week I don't use the machine, I do use anti cellulite  lotions. When I started this whole process my thighs had a lot of visible cellulite. After 6 weeks of constant use I can totally see the difference. I'm very happy with the results. I will give this product more than a 5 stars!!!!

I had high hopes--not that it would totally eliminate cellulite, but that it would even somewhat help. Well, it didn't. The machine is cumbersome and it would be very hard to use it enough where it might actually serve a purpose. I think the main objective is to increase skin elasticity and circulation and, thus, to plump up the skin's appearance. I find dry brushing and some of the caffeine skin smoothing creams more effective and user friendly.

This machine really works well. I've been using it for a month now, starting week 1, I can already see result, the skin is tighter, the dimples are less noticeable. Even my husband can tell the difference. Money well spent!

I love this product it worked!!!! Changed my shape,  reduced cellulite on the first use. The only down fall was I'm in Australia. So I needed a conversion plug to charge, other than that I would recommend to anybody.  LOVE IT

bought this seeing reviews were pretty positive! I found it to be a waste of time, money and pain! It made it look worse? I guess if you have a dimples or 2 i can see it work! But if you have celliute a lot! Don't waste your money! I had high hopes and sad to see it failed to help n made it worse
Like the machine. Used only on one side of body to see if it really works. It does. Its just a matter of finding the time to dl it. It does take more that the time they say it does.
it does not vibrate nor suction even after using more cream---would not recommend it to any of my friends or enemies

I really wish I hadn't dished out so much money on this device.  I clearly had a moment where I wasn't thinking straight.

To start, this little machine is hard and awkward to maneuver. You need so much oil to keep it rolling along smoothly.  The lower suction settings feel as if they are doing nothing, the higher ones actually left bruises on my hips and thighs.

However, I persevered, and used it as directed.  Well, my cellulite starting looking WORSE.  Still, I kept at it, thinking perhaps this was all part of the process.

Frustrated with the fact that my cellulite was even more noticeable, I  started reading up on cellulite, and discovered that devices like these can actually make the problem worse.  The skin in the areas where you have cellulite is often already very fragile and thin- and suction can further break down the collagen and connective fibers (according to what I read).

I wouldn't recommend this machine and wish I could send it back- it's essentially a $140 pos that is now retired to my bathroom cabinet after a very brief life.

I bought this little wonder a couple of months ago,and let me tell you guys,it works!
You have to be very dilligent and patient,and  do it every single day.
My skin improves a lot when I'm using it,the back of my thighs and inner thighs feel tighter,and the skin is more supple and soft than before. The machine works perfectly,the only thing that bothers me is the little filter mesh that you have to clean everytime you use the machine. I used it so much that I finally lost the little filter,and I couldn't find where to buy the same one,so I basically got a piece of cheesecloth and shaped it so it could fit and voila,it works awesome.
It's an expensive machine,so if you are not going to do it everyday,don't buy it.
Oh,and do it with the Fatgirlslim cream,I have been trying several creams with it and that one works the best.
Good luck ladies!! :)

I acknowledge of this wonderful machine reading one of my favorite magazines during a trip. At the first opportunity to search the web I did my search, read reviews and bought it. I have been using it almost every other day, although not time enough some subtle results noticed with this brief experience; thus I an fascinated.

I've been using this for three weeks and saw smoother results on the 2nd day. You have to keep up with it to see results.

This is not a weight loss product, it just smoothes things over. I pair this up with pilates/light cardio and my legs are starting to look great.

I also like the lotion it comes with. It has a light smell and makes my skin soft for a long time.

One thing though, warn your husbands/boyfriends about this.. if you don't hit the release button soon enough, it can leave some hickie-like bruises on your legs and that can make for and awkward conversation!
Works AWESOME..I had dramatic results in under 2 weeks. And saved a ton of money by doing it myself. Love it love it love it!!

The machine works as advertised - the suction can be slight or excruciating, it's up to you! I hope to see some results soon!

I like Bliss products.  But this is hard to hold and handle over all.  It also takes a lot more time than estimated by the company.  It also caused me pain fairly frequently.  Just not worth it in my opinion.

THIS IS A POWERFUL LITTLE MACHINE. I NEVER PUT MY HAND IN HOLDER I USUALLY USE BOTH HANDS ON SIDE OF MACHINE AND PULL AWAY, LIFTING MY LEG TO A 90 DEGREE ANGLE AND RESTING MY FOOT ON MY BED. IT HELPS WITH CELLULITE, NOT A WEIGHT LOSS PRODUCT PEOPLE. WORTH IT. THANKS.

The best product ever, just love it. I was looking for something like this and finally got it. worked well the first tjwo times I used it,,,, I thought I had hit the jackpot  it lost all suction power to it, this was in the third day of use..... bought this for my daughter to help with mild cellulite on the sides and back of her thighs. we saw little improvement after consistent use after 30days. she used it every night for about 2 weeks and then about every other night after, mainly because it was time consuming and worked better if she had assistance. we feel like some of the other product out there that use massage as the main source of bringing circulation to the skin would work as well or better. She is in good physical shape. about 135lbs. and very active. just recently noticed the dimpling after she had gained about 8lbs. probably heredity but I'm  sure it didn't hurt to try and improve smoothness and firm the area around the thighs. For something that makes such a fuss when you have it turned on, there should be that much more suction power.  This machine is SO LOUD. I rather try and use my hose attachment on my vacuum cleaner and attempt to suction my cellulite away that way instead.  I used it four times.  The fourth day of using it the machine started emitting this plastic burning smell. I regret wasting my time with this and this time, I really should have heeded the other reviewers' warnings. Thank you amazon for your excellent return policy and letting me return this seriously disappointing product.
I'm shocked at the outcome. It's very inexpensive for gel polish, and was a little thick when applying but it's awesome! The color change is amazing and I'm totally ordering more!!!!
Great, arrived in time and works as described.
A nail clipper for those who hate cheap nail clippers...
worst nail clipper i ever buy, JUST DON'T BUY IT.

i had no idea this is popular in China until my sister in beijng asked me to order 10 of them as gifts. OBviously it is a popular brand and perfect fit as a small gift for fiends.

I think that my décolleté area looks even drier now than it did when I was using a simple inexpensive facial moisturizer in that area. This is a good moisturizer and exfoliating product but no where near the miracle worker it claims to be and you might expect from the price. Alas this is another product that does not spring from a  fountain of youth despite its claims.

Ok, so assuming money is no object, this is a decent product. Exfoliator works well (not really for the face, more for the neck, chest, arms and body). I do love the moisturizer (body repair) it's thick and creamy (almost reminds me of my mother's old Ponds face cream). I will say that my skin feels great after a couple of weeks of use. Didn't really have a crepe problem, but I do have dry skin and some fine wrinkles. This duo does the job. However, the 4 star rating is discounting for the cost. This is really a 'trial' size, yet it is over $60 in cost. You can do better on your own using other products (I love Ahava products as well as Olay). I say shop around a bit or wait for the price to come down a bit.

I am 71 years old, and my once-beautiful skin has turned into crepe, especially on my forearms. I've used this Crepe Erase for 2 days and the difference is amazing. My skin is almost smooth, and feels soft. I love this product and will be using it a long time.

Highly Recommended

Ugh, as I get holder, my skin has more sag.  Even though I work out a lot and am a normal weight, my skin just looks looser. Thats a part of aging.

I was interested in trying this product combination to see if anything could be done about that crepe looking skin.  While, the crepe didn't completely disappear, the appearance is less.

Why I like this product:

* It has a very light pleasant scent.  So many products these days have heavy, artificial scents and I just cant tolerate that.

* The moisturizer really moisturizes without feeling super-greasy.  It is heavy enough to do the trick, but not so heavy that it feels like you want to wipe it off.

* The exfoliating gel feels good.  I was a bit concerned that this would be too drying for my skin, but I am happy to report that this isn't the case.

If you are looking for something that might just help your dry and aging skin, this might be for you.
Please note, no miracles will occur with the use of these products.  Your skin might just look a tad better.

I don't have a problem with crepiness, but I am beginning to see the very beginnings of something resembling it under my upper arms. Like yuck! (Aging really sucks.)

Naturally I'd be for anything that would forestall it. I was glad to try the Crepe Erase two part system (despite the name, which gives me the heebies.) The moisturizer is OK, the scrub like most average scrubs. So all I have to do is use a scrub and moisturize and it'll all be fine? Because regardless of what the company claims, after several weeks, I see zero change in my incipient underarm crepiness. If this product is supposed to make a difference, it's not doing a thing I can see.

Two stars cause the products aren't horrible, but minus three stars cause I don't see that they do at all what the manufacturer claims. You can get a similar result a lot cheaper with almost any moisturizer and sugar scrub for a LOT less. Pass.

The movie was boring even my kids didn't want to sit and watch it with me it's a put u to sleep movie
